title: What Does TTM Mean? Snapchat, Texting, and More

steps.title: On Snapchat, it means "talk to me."
steps.content: On Snapchat, it means "talk to me." People usually send “TTM” as a way to get the recipient to chat with them. Other people use “TTM” to offer support to a friend or loved one, or as a way to express extra interest in someone’s life. Here are some other abbreviations that include “TTM:” TTML: Talk to me later TTMN: Talk to me now DTTM: Don’t talk to me [1] X Research source

steps.title: TTM means "talk to me" in texting (and on all digital platforms).
steps.content: TTM means "talk to me" in texting (and on all digital platforms). This acronym isn’t exclusive to Snapchat, and you might see it pop up in your texts, as well as other messaging apps.

steps.title: Encourage someone to message you.
steps.content: Encourage someone to message you. Maybe it’s been a week since you hit up your friend, or you’re looking to reconnect with someone you haven’t chatted with a while. “TTM” is a cool, snappy way to get your message across. “Long time no see. TTM!” “It’s been awhile. TTM!” “How’ve you been? TTM!”

steps.title: Lend someone a listening ear.
steps.content: Lend someone a listening ear. It’s tough to figure out the right thing to say when a friend or loved one is going through a rough time. Remind them that you’re there for them with a quick “TTM,” and that you’re happy to listen if they need to vent. “Sounds like you had a rough day. You can always TTM if you want.” “I can’t begin to imagine what you’re going through, but please know that I’m here. Feel free to TTM anytime.”

steps.title: Invite a friend to spill all the exciting details.
steps.content: Invite a friend to spill all the exciting details. Did your roommate just get back from an awesome vacation? Did your friend get front-row seats to a concert? Encourage them to share every last detail of their adventure with a quick “TTM!” “OMG, I saw the pics of the party on your Instagram story last night. TTM!” “Was that Troy in your last Snap, or am I just seeing things? TTM!”

steps.title: Shoot a reply back if you feel like it.
steps.content: Shoot a reply back if you feel like it. Someone's asking you to talk to them, so you might as well send a response if you're in the mood! Feel free to say something like: "Hey there! How's it going?" "I really appreciate your support. You’re a really good friend!” "Okay, okay! I’ll tell you everything. It’s a pretty crazy story though!”

steps.title: Ignore the message if you'd rather not answer.
steps.content: Ignore the message if you'd rather not answer. "TTM" is a pretty lazy way to start up a conversation, and it doesn't give you very much to work with. If the person really wants to talk with you, they can send a more specific, personalized message.

steps.title: Trailing Twelve Months:
steps.content: Trailing Twelve Months: Taking a plunge into the world of business? A Trailing Twelve Months, or TTM, is a way that businesses measure and monitor their growth and performance. A TTM can focus specifically on a business’s revenue and yield, as well as the price-to-earnings ratio. Many companies utilize a TTM as they financially plan and prepare for the future. [2] X Research source A TTM is like a condensed, financial snapshot of a company. It’s a great way for managers and supervisors to keep tabs on how things are going.

steps.title: Through The Mail:
steps.content: Through The Mail: Big sports fan? Lots of fans like sending photos and cards through the mail for their favorite players to sign and send back. TTM databases help fans know which players are most likely to sign and send back autographed materials. [3] X Research source
